statement: I’m more confident moving forward when there’s a clear plan instead of improvising.
I tend to slow down decisions if I sense tension or discomfort between people.
I lose steam when things feel routine or predictable for too long.
I feel responsible for keeping things moving when others hesitate.
I prefer to think through possible outcomes before committing to a direction.
I’m willing to compromise on speed if it helps maintain trust.
I’m more productive when I enjoy the process, not just the outcome.
I’m comfortable being the one who takes the heat if a decision doesn’t work out.
I get uneasy when expectations aren’t clearly defined.
I’m motivated when I feel connected to the people involved, not just the task.
